ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Grammar, basic big themes in spanish, literature & art
More advanced Spanish sentence and grammar structures, more fluency in the language, and more knowledge about Spanish culture of a variety of Spanish speaking countries.
This course does a good job of intersecting Spanish cultural exploration while introducing new vocabulary and tenses.

I learned how to analyze and interpret poems, films, short films, short stories and novels in Spanish. I learned a lot more about Spanish culture and the different traditions and historical events that have been important to different Spanish speaking countries.
How to write better in Spanish particularly and add emphasis to my speaking skills

I improved my Spanish grammar, reading comprehension, and conversational fluency skills. I learned more about the cultures of various Spanish-speaking countries as well as contemporary and past issues. I also improved my ability to analyze and interpret videos, movies, and various texts concerning different cultural topics pertaining to Latin America.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Fun combination of the types of activities, engaging content. Slightly repetitive at times.

Most of the material and assignments were very engaging and interesting. The projects were a lot of fun and I feel like I learned a lot through these projects while enjoy creating and presenting them. The course could be improved by having clearer uses of specific grammar structures and more in class practice of these specific structures.

Things that were good: Asynchronous wednesdays, tambin la lluvia, the short stories

Things that were bad:  A lot of presentations

Strengths: We did not do so much memorization and repetition, but could apply our L1 and L2 knowledge to real world examples and stories by Spanish poets and authors.

Weaknesses: I was hoping we could focus more on practical Spanish (directions, ordering food, navigating in an airport), but most of our classroom discussions were focused on texts & ideas, not situations.
More diversity in exercises and grammar practice

A few strengths were the smaller class setting which fostered more connections between classmates as well as the teacher.  I also enjoyed the casual and conversational aspect. I liked that the class had more creative projects as opposed to being heavily test based. I also enjoyed having one asynchronous class a week. The only weakness was that the projects were not well dispersed towards the end.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes. For anyone who wants to take Spanish this was an excellent, low stress, fun class. The workload was fair. The subjects taught were interesting and helpful to improving my Spanish. Overall I really enjoyed the class and would recommend it to anyone who wants to take Spanish.
I would definitely recommend this course to another student, although this course is restricted by Spanish level.

I definitely would - it is a great application of prior Spanish knowledge, and an opportunity to dive deeper into Spanish art, literature and culture. The workload is very manageable and for this reason, prioritizes class participation and conversation over memorization and examinations.

Yes, I would recommend this course to another student. The units and topics we learned were well-structured and the variety of assignments and projects allowed for us to be tested and challenged in different ways.  The close class setting combined with the excellent learning environment was an optimal course setting.
Yes, the professor and activities were amazing!
